intro: Ceropegia circes, commonly known as the silver leaf ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pale green or white in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Ceropegia circes is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to store water in its thick stems.
